results.title: Vision in our valley
results.brief_description: This film discusses the economic and environmental problems of the Muskingum Watershed, which makes up 1/5 of the State of Ohio. The area was becoming more poor due to frequent floods, droughts and intensive farming. Through co-operation among various agencies, the area has become completely renewed. By explaining how this happened, the film makes suggestions for solutions to similar problems of conservation elsewhere.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: the unit circle
results.brief_description: Gives an activity to determine the mathematical relationship “sine” and shows how to apply the principle of “sine” in measuring the heights of various objects.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: relations
results.brief_description: Opens up with images of Ron Clarke, Donald Campbell and Jack Brabham. Displays the symbols used for expressing familiar mathematical relationships to raise the question of how such relationships can be expressed. Discusses and illustrates several methods of notation.

results.title: Vincent Van Gogh
results.brief_description: Van Gogh’s life story, the development of his work and his struggle against madness and poverty told by excerpts from his letters to his beloved brother, Theo. The artist’s paintings and scenes taken at localities in which he lived and worked provide the visual material. Shows his early drawings, his move to Paris, his time in Arles and Saintes-Maries and his enthusiasm for the southern landscape, his time in hospitals at Arles and Saint-Remy, Gauguin’s visit, and Van Gogh’s final sojourn with a doctor in Auvers near Paris.

results.title: Victoria changing faces changing places
results.brief_description: This short documentary addresses the issues that surround Victoria’s growing population, whilst also probing the past and how migration helped shaped the current demographic. Using voice-over narration, this features an array of archival footage to examine the underlying drivers of population growth, with a view to understanding how the community is changing, and the what the future is likely to hold for Victoria.

results.title: Vibrato
results.creator_credit: Gerald Hagner, Gerald Hagner Productions and Ohio Arts Council
results.brief_description: Using camera movement, multiple images, and synchronised music to transform nature into a statement of beauty, Gerald Hagner’s award winning film presents a stunning impression of the Appalachian mountains. Without narration. Photographed by Gerald Hagner alone in the Appalachian Mountains, Ohio and synchronised music by Art Kempel.
